author: Jason Gay
title: What It Means to Tell an Olympic Story
text:
I had to see the phenomenon for myself—Pita Taufatofua, the improbable Tongan double Olympian, Rio taekwondoka turned Pyeongchang cross-country skier, shirtless flag bearer, and unrivaled dreamboat heartthrob of The Wall Street Journal sports section. 

I’ll assume you’ve read a thing or two about Pita. His journey from oil-lathered obscurity to international feel-good athlete has been endearingly followed across multiple continents by my Journal colleagues, Ben Cohen and Josh Robinson. Cohen & Robinson are the Woodward...
